title: Kimmeter Park Green
text:
Kimmeter Park Green was a <a href="association%20football">football</a> ground in <a href="Annan%2C%20Dumfries%20and%20Galloway">Annan</a>, <a href="Scotland">Scotland</a>. It was the home ground of <a href="Solway%20Star%20F.C.">Solway Star</a> from 1921 until 1939, and hosted <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish Football League</a> matches between 1923 and 1926.
History.
Solway Star moved to Kimmeter Park Green in 1921 from their Summergate Park ground, which they had played at for only a year. The facilities at the new ground initially included a small stand on the western side of the pitch, as well as some changing rooms, and in 1923 a new 300-capacity grandstand was built. In the same year the club were elected into the new Third Division of the <a href="Scottish%20Football%20League">Scottish Football League</a>, and the first SFL match at Kimmeter Park Green was played on 25 August 1923, a 2–1 win over <a href="Peebles%20Rovers%20F.C.">Peebles Rovers</a>. The club's highest recorded league attendance at the ground was 3,000, set for a match against <a href="Queen%20of%20the%20South%20F.C.">Queen of the South</a> on 11 October 1924; the match ending in a 1–1 draw.
Division Three was disbanded at the end of the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Scottish%20Football%20League">1925–26 season</a>, resulting in Solway Star leaving the league. The final SFL match at the ground was played on 3 April 1926, a 3–2 defeat by <a href="Johnstone%20F.C.">Johnstone</a>.
The club ceased playing at the ground in 1939, moving to Mafeking Park after <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>. The site of Kimmeter Park Green was returned to agricultural use; the grandstand was partially demolished and the remainder of the structure used as a cowshed.
